markdown.markdown:
### 2025 - **Min, S.**, K.-H. Ahn. Projections and uncertainty decomposition in CMIP6 models for extreme precipitation scaling rates. ***Journal of Hydrology***. [https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jhydrol.2025.133260](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jhydrol.2025.133260)
## Conferences ### Decomposing Uncertainty in Projected Changes in Extreme Precipitation: A Dynamic and Thermodynamic Perspective 23 May 2025 Yeosu, South Korea – Korea Water Resources Association Annual Conference I presented research on the exploration of uncertainty in extreme precipitation and its two components: thermodynamic and dynamic processes, as well as their associated uncertainties. The study decomposes total projection uncertainty into three well-known sources in climate science: model structure, emission scenarios, and internal variability. You can find my presentation [here](https://www.beautiful.ai/player/-OTgegQWDbWabRe-xVrr). ### Decomposing uncertainty in extreme precipitation scaling rates for future climate projection 10 May 2024 Jeju, South Korea – Korea Water Resources Association Annual Conference Extreme precipitation is strongly linked to temperature, as warmer conditions allow the atmosphere to hold more moisture, enhancing the potential for intense rainfall. However, this relationship is found to be highly uncertain. In this talk, I explored the uncertainty surrounding the projected increase rates of extreme precipitation under future climate scenarios. I was selected as the Oral Best Presentation Winner for the international session. You can find my presentation [here](https://www.beautiful.ai/player/-OTggm7M00w8VhizoPt6).
